citations.narrative:
Records were incomplete for some recently acquired animals: 3 dwarf hamsters, 4 juvenile coatis, and a few sugar gliders
that had been born on the property.
It is important to keep complete records for animals acquired (purchased or donated) so that animals can be located if
there is a disease outbreak, or if there are questions about animal sales.
Correct going forwards for all future animals acquired (bought or donated) by documenting the following information for
each animal:
1) The name and address of the seller (or donor) and their USDA license number (if they do not have a USDA license, the
record should show their driver's license number and vehicle tag number and state).
2) The date that the animal was purchased (or if born on site, the date of birth).
3) The species of the animal.
4) The number of animals in the shipment.
When animals are sold, records must show the name and address of the buyer, the date, and the species of animals, and
the number of animals.
CORRECT BY: November 2, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the owner.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Records were incomplete for some recently acquired animals: 3 dwarf hamsters, 4 juvenile coatis, and a few sugar gliders 
that had been born on the property.  
It is important to keep complete records for animals acquired (purchased or donated) so that animals can be located if 
there is a disease outbreak, or if there are questions about animal sales.  
Correct going forwards for all future animals acquired (bought or donated) by documenting the following information for 
each animal:  
1) The name and address of the seller (or donor) and their USDA license number (if they do not have a USDA license, the 
record should show their driver's license number and vehicle tag number and state). 
2) The date that the animal was purchased (or if born on site, the date of birth).  
3) The species of the animal.  
4) The number of animals in the shipment.  
When animals are sold, records must show the name and address of the buyer, the date, and the species of animals, and 
the number of animals. 
CORRECT BY: November 2, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the owner.
